info.name: KanbanBoardAPI
info.description:
# Introduction
This api provides a number of endpoints to facilitate the logic for kanban board application.

# Authentication
Authentification is currently not required

request.description: Lists all kanban boards stored in the database and populates the referenced swimlanes in them.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: content-length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: content-type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: etag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: keep-alive
header.description: Custom header

header.name: x-powered-by
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

request.description:
Finds one board based on its title, the associated swimlanes are populated:

Requires field "title" in the header. 

If no board is found, returns a corresponding error message.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin

request.description:
Deletes a kanban board by title. Also deletes all swimlanes referenced by the kanban board. Has no effect if kanban board is not found:

Needs the following headers:

Content-Type: application/json

Needs a title in the body formatted as json:

{'title': 'yourtitle'}

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

request.description:
Creates a new kanban board. Kanbanboards have to be unique by title, if kanban board already exists, has no effect.

Required headers:

Content-Type: application/json

Needs title parameter in the json body of the request:

{"title": "Pavel's board"}

response.name: host_url/createNewKanbanBoard

header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

response.body: Successfully created a new kanban board

request.description:
Adds a new SwimLane to the kanban board. If no board exists, has no effect.

Required headers:

Content-Type: application/json

Needs title parameter in the json body of the request for both kanban board and SwimLane:

{
	"kanbanBoardTitle":"Pavel",
	"swimLaneTitle": "Test"
}

request.description:
For testing purposes only. Adds a dummy kanban board titled "Test" and 3 associated swim lanes when accessed.

Does not care about headers and body.

Does not care about header and body.
